str2: Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I rule, reign, (b) I reign over. From basileus; to rule.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Mortal, subject to death. From thnesko; liable to die.
Body, flesh; the body of the Church. From sozo; the body, used in a very wide application, literally or figuratively.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
From hupo and akouo; to hear under, i.e. To listen attentively; by implication, to heed or conform to a command or authority.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Neuter 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Desire, eagerness for, inordinate desire, lust. From epithumeo; a longing.
